inn1.comm: good start from the old warhorse, pitching right up there on off stump and getting a fraction of movement inside, not a very quick delivery, about 120ks, and Vincent defends
better lift this time, hitting the deck and lifting up from outside off stump as Vincent shoulders arms
and again, this one pitches on a short length and carries high to Boucher, after Vincent gets a good look in and decides to leave it be
full now, off stumpish, and Vincent pushes into the covers off the front foot but declines the single
short of a length outside off stump, Vincent watches it through to Boucher
short of a length outside off again, rising up nicely and Vincent shoulders arms
bowled from very wide of the crease, short of a length into his ribs and he calmly tucks it into the gap around the corner for the first run of the innings
quick, short and forcing Vincent to duck low as the ball sails over his head, umpire calls it wide for the excess height, well fair enough
short of a length outside off stump, again Vincent shoulders arms
good lift of the pitch as Vincent gets up tall and leaves it be, Ntini making the ball come back in off the upright seam as well today
fuller length, jagging back into him, he's tucked up as ball thuds into his upper thigh, then McCullum calls for a leg-bye, sharp running that
140ks, short of a length outside off and now McCullum leaves it be
full on off stump, McCullum shuffles and digs it out wide of mid-on, running hard with Vincent and pushing for triple as a wayward through comes back to Ntini
good length well outside off stump, McCullum gets across and leaves it be
good channel again, cant really drive nor cut that length and so he leaves it

hello! McCullum walks across his stumps, Pollock sees him coming and digs it in short, then McCullum tries to hook that out of the ground but just misses as the ball deviates past his gloves, Boucher collects and they all go up in raucous appeal but the umpire is unmoved
short outside off stump, comes back in a long way and raps McCullum's chest as he shoulders arms ... thats a good length to bowl
good length outside off and again McCullum shoulders arms
straight ball on leg stump, he hops up and works it straight to midwicket
good lord, he makes room and tries to pull a short ball outside off stump, instead chopping into the ground in front of Boucher off the toe end of the bat
jaffa from Ntini at 140ks, angled in, hitting a sweet length and moving past his bat as he plays from his crease, how did that miss kissing the outer edge?
clubbed! Vincent likes the length and swivels on the back foot, pulling Ntini high and handsome over midwicket for half a dozen

and what a reply it is, though that was a silly shot, honestly! Ntini pitches full on the stumps and Vincent goes for some sort of drive across the line, from deep in his crease and with minimal footwork, missing by a country mile and losing his leg stump, first blood for South Africa
quick delivery, pitching on a length and swinging down leg to rap him high on the knee roll, welcome, welcome, says Ntini
full on off stump and How squeezes that straight to cover
short of a length outside off stump, sits up and McCullum shoulders arms
short of a length again, this time seaming away from him as he hops and leaves
edged and runs away to third man, as McCullum hops up and plays a short one away from his body, luck to find the gap wide of  the slips and gully for one
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up and leaves it be
short of a length again, and How leaves it be, getting up on the toes
fuller length on the stumps and he plays that back to Pollock
too full, too straight and McCullum whips that very hard off the pads past square leg, not timed too well and in the air, but safely past Botha for four
short of a length outside off stump, and he leaves it be this time
short and wide but he mistimes his cut shot straight to cover, Duminy
strays way down leg stump, and its clipped down to fine leg for one
good delivery, a nice length on off stump and he comes forward to defend
good length outside off stump, he gets forward and shoulders arms
short on the stumps, McCullum's waiting for it and gets back to slap it out to deep midwicket, looks like Morne van Wyk out there
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up and across to leave it alone
good ball! Hits the deck and comes in a mile, the offcutter, and catches him very high on the thigh as he gets up and shoulders arms, wouldve missed the stumps
short and wide outside off stump, and he's comfortable just shouldering arms
a touch fuller this time, McCullum gets onto the front foot and leaves it be
short of a length, moving away off the seam and again, McCullum leaves it
and he starts off with a wide, fell outside off stump
good length outside off stump, he gets up and leaves it be again
beaten! Nel pitches full and sucks him into a drive off the front foot, the ball deviates past the outside edge as he goes for the shot
full again, this time How comes forward and wisely leaves it be
straighter delivery on off stump, drawing him forward as he pushes back to Nel
fraction short, sits up nicely and How gets into position in a flash, pulling over midwicket for four ... Nel shakes his head and walks back to his mark
short of a length outside off stump, How gets up and pushes with soft hands into the covers, setting off for a maniacal single and just making his ground as the throw is astray ... nerves, nerves!
short outside off stump, again How pulls but this time its just the single out to van Wyk at deep midwicket
good length on off stump, McCullum gets in line and defends back to Pollock
full on off stump, he defends and gets an inside-edge to midwicket
good length outside off stump, McCullum gets forward and shoulders arms
top shot, McCullum just scooping a full delivery on the pads up and over midwicket for another boundary, all wrist work and placement
short of a length, comes back in and stays a touch low as McCullum works it into midwicket for a single to get him back on strike
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up and leaves it alone this time
full and straight, he gets across and whips it through the line past midwicket
short and rising outside off stump, he judges it well, gets upright, and leaves
good length well outside the stumps, he gets forward and shoulders arms
short of a length, he gets into position and pushes wide of mid-off for one
good length outside off, he watchfully leaves it be to end the over
good length outside off, he reaches well forward and defends uneasily to point
back of a length outside off, he gets up and pushes straight to cover
good length outside off stump, McCullum drives loosely and almost edges to backward point, early into the shot and playing it away from the body, the ball not carrying
short of a length on the stumps, he shuffles and works it to square leg
short and wide, asking for trouble, except How hits it off the toe end of the bat and it dribbles to second slip, not timed well at all
full and wide, How gets onto the front foot and shoulders arms to end the over
short and wide, McCullum waits and angles the bat to work it through the gap and down to third man for a single, was uppish but safe
fuller length outside off stump, How comes forward and defends
full again and How gets right over it, defending to cover
much wider this time, How leaves off the front foot and a wide is indeed called
slides down leg stump off a length, he goes for the tickle but misses, the ball looping up off his pads to midwicket as Nel runs after it
full on off stump, he gets over it and defends back to Nel
short and rising outside off stump, he gets across and shoulders arms
full and wide, he gets onto the front foot and leaves it be, very watchfully
again, its that good length outside off and the batsman just leaves it be
tighter one, closer to off stump and he defends it into the covers
movement, as it pitches full on off stump and swings down to catch him high above the knee roll as he lunges forward to try and defend
good ball, Pollock holding the length back and getting it to deviate away, forcing him to play away from his body and miss completely
good length on the stumps, pushed to the fielder
short of a length outside off, too close to cut but he does so anyway, and misses as the ball comes back in
heave ho! McCullum says stuff this, and has an ugly swat across the line at a fuller delivery, making contact with nothing but air
short ball down leg stump, he gets up and works it around the corner to short leg
fraction short down leg again, he shuffles and pulls out to deep backward square
swing and a miss! He's itching to hammer it out of the ground, getting cramped into the pull and missing altogether ... thats just not the length to pull, mate
full on the stumps, he gets forward and plays it back to the bowler
delivered from very wide of the crease, pitching on a length and moving off the seam, striking him on the pads after he shuffles well across off stump, cant give those out, sorry
too short, angling down leg and McCullum hooks to deep fine leg for four, just getting into shape and rolling the wrists very hard, top shot that
good length this time, drawing McCullum forward to defend right to cover
short of a length outside off stump, coming back into McCullum sharply, who gets in line and tucks it straight to midwicket
full outside off, McCullum gets well forward and pushes into the covers for one
nips back in off a length and he survives with an inside-edge onto the pads
too full outside off stump and McCullum whips it past midwicket, all wrists on that
good length outside off stump, this time he leaves it be, almost beaten
short of a length, good carry through to Boucher, McCullum leaves it alone
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up and leaves it be again
short and wide, moving away from McCullum, who goes for a flashy cut but misses by some distance
short of a length, jagging back in, he hops and edges it into the ground in front of the slips, How calls for the quick single and gets it rather easily too
good length on off stump, McCullum defends straight to cover
good length outside off stump, he shapes to work it across to leg, inside-edges into the covers and calls for the run, Duminy runs around and fires in a throw but misses
overpitched outside off stump and McCullum tries to club it down the ground but cant beat Smith at mid-off
short of a length on middle and leg, he shuffles up and rolls it out to Kallis at deep backward square leg for a single
much fuller on off stump, he gets forward and pushes to cover
sharp delivery nips back off a length and cuts How in half, driving from his crease as the ball jags back for Boucher to collect
short of a length outside off stump, McCullum gets up and drops it in front of de Villiers at point for one, he swoops in and slides as the lets the ball go, missing the stumps
good length outside off, he thinks about a drive but holds back on the shot
full on off stump, he gets over it and defends it to cover, patiently
whats this? How wakes up, pulling a short ball from Morkel just over midwicket for four, where did that come from?
back to back! Morkel overcompensates by pitching full, and How transfers his weight onto the front foot, timing a lovely straight drive past the stumps
short and rising outside off stump, he ends the over by shouldering arms
too full outside off stump, McCullum flicks through midwicket out to the deep, where Kallis covers good ground, dives on the ropes, and prevents a boundary
full on middle and leg, How on-drives but cant beat either of the fielders
good length on off stump, he gets forward and defends to midwicket now
delivered from very, very wide of the crease, he gets across and leaves it be
full into the blockhole, How uses the feet and drives to extra cover, well done
nice one, How getting into his groove and unfurling a nice drive through extra cover, just getting to the pitch and driving on the up for four
short and a touch wide, he gets up and places it into the gap for one
full in the blockhole and How digs it out to mid-off
ah, pleasing, as How leans into a nice on-drive back past McCullum and the stumps and beats mid-on by some distance
overpitched outside off stump, How kneels forward and drives to cover, where the awkward bounce beats Duminy, who dives over it and allows a couple
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up and shoulders arms
full outside off stump again, How gets down and drives to cover, Duminy dives and gets a hand on it, taking some pace off the ball, and van Wyk covers up from mid-off
tossed up full from over the stumps, on leg stump, and its flicked to midwicket
flat on middle and leg, he shuffles and works it to midwicket
slower through the air, down leg stump, McCullum steps outside the line and is in a terrible position to flick, so he defends it back
tossed up on middle and off, he drives back to Botha's left for one
tossed up on leg stump, he shuffles and flicks past midwicket for two, as van Wyk and Kallis are late to react in the deep
quicker and flatter on off stump, How comes forward and pushes to cover
short of a length on off stump, McCullum gets behind the line and defends
slants down the pads and he flicks wristily through square leg, settling for one
full on off stump, How comes forward and drives, inside-out, to mid-off
short and rising, How goes for his pull but misses completely, the ball passing the bat by some distance as he swivels in his shot
good length on off stump, How gets in line and drives straight to mid-on
howhughauazaat, shouts a pumped-up Morkel! Full on the stumps, he falls forward and drives, getting an inside-edge onto the front leg and that cannot be given out
full toss, and he heaves it out to the Kallis on the deep, but on the bounce
tossed up down leg stump, he turns it to short fine leg and runs hard
tossed up on the stumps, holding it back in the air, and he's almost beaten
bowled 'em! McCullum gives him the charge, shuffling across the line and missing a full and flat yorker on the stumps, and Botha erupts in celebration
tossed up on off stump, Styris comes forward and turns it to square leg for one
tossed up on off stump, How tucks it straight to midwicket
sharp bouncer outside off stump, kicks up and surprises Styris, who gets his head out of the way, dropping the bat too, as it sniffs his nose
short of a length but he gets up and over it, dropping with soft hands wide of backward point for an easy single
good length outside off stump, How has a look-see and then shoulders arms
short of a length, still in that channel where How is unsure of what to do, and so he gets tall and allows it to pass
slower ball, a touch fuller this time outside off, and again How leaves it go
full on off stump, How gets over it and defends into the covers to end the over
tossed up on off stump, nudged wide of point for a quick single
tossed up on off stump, How gets over it and smothers the spin
flatter on middle and leg, worked straight to square leg
thats the one that goes straight and How doesn't pick it, but adjusts to play it with soft hands down to point
tossed up on the stumps, Styris waits and tucks it into the midwicket gap for one
quicker and flatter on middle and leg, How drives to mid-on
full length outside off stump, he comes forward and steers past point for one
good length outside off, How gets onto the front foot and shoulders arms
short of a length on middle and off, he gets up and tucks it through midwicket
short of a length on off stump, he waits and drops it in front of point for one more
fuller on off stump, he gets impetuous and carves it out to deep midwicket, with plenty of bottom hand on that shot
short of a length outside off stump, Styris gets tall, waits for it, and watchfully runs it through gully and down towards Nel, doing duty at third man
full and flat on off stump, Styris flicks wide of midwicket for a single
tossed up on leg stump, How turns it straight to the man at short fine leg
gives it some air, pitches on the stumps and drifts the other way, How gets in line and defends it back to Botha
low full toss on middle and leg, all he can do is hit it to midwicket
drifts down leg stump, he tucks it wide of the fielder for one more
tossed up on the stumps, he uses the feet and drives to midwicket
too short on the stumps, How latches on and pulls through midwicket, Botha slides around on the ropes but doesn't stop it
too full on off stump, he leans down and drives to extra cover
short again, down the stumps, How swivels and pulls past square leg, placing it between Ntini at fine leg and Botha at deep backward square for four more
better stuff from Morkel, full on off stump and he drives nicely to extra cover
short of a length outside off stump, How chops it wide of a diving de Villiers at point and picks up runs as Nel runs around from third man
ah, what an over for How, getting a nice juicy half-volley on leg stump and he moves to 49 with a sumptuous flick past midwicket that races across the turf
flat on middle and leg, Styris uses the feet and drives wide of mid-on for one
tossed up full on middle stump, How works it across to leg but cant find the gap
tossed up on leg stump, again he tucks off the pads but de Villiers is too sharp
there's the fifty, his third in ODIs, as How tucks one wide of square leg ... well played
tossed up on the stumps, he gets forward and drives to the fielder
tossed up on the stumps, he gets forward and drives to mid-on for one
tossed up gently on the stumps, Styris flicks it to midwicket
tossed up on middle and off, worked towards midwicket again
tossed up outside off stump, How gets over it and defends to cover, calling for one
tossed up down leg, he waits and then nudges off the pads into the gap
drifts onto the pads again, and he tickles it past square leg
tossed up on a length, Styris comes forward and steers it wide of point for one
flat on leg stump, he opens the face and pushes towards de Villiers at point
tossed up on the stumps, he shuffles across and flicks wide of short fine leg
full and flat outside off, steered to backward point and he sets off, but How sends him back as Pollock reacts quickly and fires in the throw
again Styris steers to Pollock and wants one, but How wisely says no thanks, chief
tossed up on middle and leg, he comes out and drives to mid-on
tossed up on off stump and How defends it back to Botha
tossed up outside off stump, Styris advances a long way and drives to cover
flatter delivery, Styris comes down the track again and clubs it back, Duminy gets a hand on it but the ball ricochets onto the non-striker's stumps
a fraction short and wide, Styris cuts it wide of Pollock at gully for two
shot! Short and wide again, he gets back and cuts well, finer, and gets four
tossed up on the stumps, he uses the feet and flicks through midwicket
drifts down leg stump, he waits and tickles it into the gap
tossed up on leg stump, he flicks wide of midwicket for a single
tossed up on off stump, How checks the line and defends
quicker, fuller, flatter on off stump and How goes for an agricultural slog across the line, mistiming it towards midwicket
tossed up again, this time he shuffles and works it away for one, raising the 50 stand
tossed up outside off, Styris kneels down and drives into the covers
tossed up on leg stump, he gets back and works it into the gap with ease
full on the stumps, How tries to flick but mistimes the shot and has to listen to Nel drone on about the weather, the birds and the bees, yadda yadda yadda
short of a length outside off stump, pushed to cover and he cant find the gap
clumped! Thats merely a fraction short but How gets into his favorite shot, pulling supremely through midwicket
close! Nel pitches full on leg stump, How shuffles and flicks uppishly but the ball doesn't carry to Botha at midwicket
good length on the stumps, he comes forward and drives for one
short of a length outside off stump, Styris waits and steers wide of point
short and wide, Styris steers that through gully and Nel fumbles down there
heave ho! Styris advances, looking to smear this over mid-off, but gets a thick edge that flies down to Nel at third man, had that hit it was outta here
good length on the stumps, he gets forward and pokes to the fielder at point
short of a length this time, he gets up and cant find the gap again
short and wide, he gets over it and cuts well but again, just cant beat de Villiers
finally he picks the gap, getting back and punching one past cover out to the deep
full outside off stump, he drives well but cant beat the man at short cover
short of a length outside off stump, he plays that late through gully for one
good length outside off stump, he gets forward and pushes past point
short delivery outside off stump, Styris latches on with a controlled pull out to Morkel at deep midwicket, bringing up New Zealand's 150
full on off stump, How goes for another bottom-handed swipe across the line, picking the gap wide of mid-on, Botha gives chase and hauls it in on the ropes
short again, sits up and he pulls through square leg nicely
full on the stumps, whipped past mid-on for another hard-run couple
short and rising, Styris gets back and plays it late, running through where slip would be and down to Nel at third man
slower ball, pitching on a length outside the stumps and he waits, dabbing it with an open face through gully
good length outside off stump, he drives from his crease and cant beat point
good length outside off, sitting up a touch and beating him as he pushes at it
short of a length outside off, steered backward of point for one more

gone! Nel steams in, pitches short of a length, the slower ball, Styris has a big heave as he attempts to go over midwicket, just mistiming it up in the air for midwicket to settle under a steepler and judge it to perfection
short and wide, he gets up and slaps it through point out to the sweeper
good length outside off stump, Taylor gets the front foot out and leaves it be
this one nips back sharply off a short length but Taylor has off stump covered, and chops it from the crease into the ground in front of Boucher
strays onto the pads and Taylor works it wide of mid-on to open his account
this one drifts down leg stump again he tucks it down to short fine leg
short of a length, jags in and Taylor chops to de Villiers at point
straighter one on the stumps, Taylor shuffles and works to it midwicket
slower delivery outside off, on a length, and Taylor steers it past gully for one
good length well wide of the stumps, he opens the face and runs to third man
short of a length, Taylor is cramped for room and chops into the covers
good length outside off stump, he drives uneasily to point this time for one
short and wide, he gets up tall and crunches it but de Villiers dives to his left at backward point to save runs
swish! Full and wide, Taylor kneels down and drives lustily, beaten completely
short of a length outside off stump, cracked off the back foot out to deep cover
width again and he reaches out, driving up and over backward point to sweeper
gets width again, comes onto the front foot and slashes over point out to Kallis
full on the stumps, he straight drives well but Morkel intercepts it, well stopped
tossed up on middle and leg, he waits and works it to midwicket for one
flatter on leg stump, he uses the feet and drives to long-on for one more
tossed up down leg stump, he kneels down and sweeps for one more
tossed up on a length, he gets across and turns it past square leg with ease
quicker through the air, he tucks it to van Wyk at short fine leg
tossed up on the stumps, Taylor gets down and sweeps in the air down to a diving Kallis at deep backward square leg, who doesn't get there in time
slower ball, almost a low full toss, How drives straight to extra cover
full delivery on the stumps, How drives it back to Morkel, who fields it
well bowled, changing the pace and getting it to stop on How, who leans well forward and has to adjust to the extra bounce, defending to point
slower one again, a length on off stump, he walks across the stumps and gets a leading-edge safely up and over square leg
full on off stump, Taylor uses the feet and drives to Botha down at long-on
another slower ball, short and staying low outside off as How pulls and misses
aye, tension! tossed up, Taylor slogs it out to deep midwicket, where Kallis dives up and to his right, cupping it safely but his back foot looks to have hit the ropes in the process .. thats six!
tossed up on the stumps, he uses the feet and on-drives for one
tossed up on the stumps, How gets forward and defends it back
poor ball, wide down leg stump and How does well to tickle it down to fine leg
tossed up on a length, he gets forward and chips into the gap
flatter on leg stump, Taylor shuffles and flicks to mid-on for a single
short one sits up and surprises Taylor, forcing him up on the toes as he chases
that'll be wide, the bouncer just sailing over his head as he goes for a slog
simple catch! Taylor advances to a short delivery and swings out to Nel, well positioned out at deep midwicket, who holds it with utmost ease
good length on off stump, How gets in line and drives back to Morkel
straighter delivery, he gets inside the line and tucks it towards mid-on
gets a sharp rising delivery coming in from outside off, but he plays it well, leaning  back and running it down to third man
much fuller on the stumps, How shuffles and drives to mid-on again
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up, riding it well, down to gully
sharp delivery jags back in and catches him in the midriff, then rolls to slip
uses the feet and clips a full delivery over Pollock at mid-on for two
full outside off stump,  pushed to point and they scamper one, which raises 200
full in the slot, How uses Ntini's pace to clip across the line for a one-bounce four over mid-on's head, good slog
fuller this time and he again carves across the line, failing to beat midwicket
full outside off stump, Sinclair goes for the cheeky steer to third man, with an inside-edge, that negates Morkel's loud appeal
full and straight, How rolls the wrists and gets one out to Nel at deep midwicket
slower ball, short of a length, Sinclair pulls uneasily past midwicket for a couple
attempted yorker, Sinclair does well to dig it out over Morkel, running hard as the ball rolls back past the stumps
full on the stumps, How gets across and drives to mid-on for one
attempted yorker ends up a low full toss, which Sinclair drives to long-on
too full down leg stump, Sinclair walks across the stumps and clips it away, with fine leg up thats four more to the scoreboard
short outside off stump this time, Sinclair gets up and steers it to point
comes out of his crease, Ntini changes the line and Sinclair taps it to midwicket
low full toss on the pads, How clips to Smith at midwicket, could've belted that
makes room to leg, then gets beaten outside off stump going for a cheeky steer
ding dong! This time Sinclair connects well, skipping down to meet it on the full and he tees off with a one-bounce four over Ntini's head
good ball, yorker just outside off and beating How as he clips across the line
full outside off stump, he swings across the line and works the gap at mid-on
castled! Nel pitches immaculately and gets it to swing in, How goes for his preferred clip across the line, only to inside-edge onto middle stump on 90! A good innings come to a close

bowled 'em first ball! Nel pitches full and nips it back off the seam, Hopkins is beaten for movement as he plays a nothing push from the crease and leg stump goes cartwheeling! Look at Nel go! Thats  two in two balls
and its not to be, as Mills shuffles across and taps it to midwicket for a sharp single, Nel sprints forward, collects, and has a shy at the stumps
yorker on leg stump, well dug out and its just a single to long-on
makes room, advancing, Ntini pitches short and Sinclair pokes it to point
full on off stump, Sinclair does well to squeeze it wide of de Villiers at backward point, Nel steams across from third man, dives superbly, and saves a four
comes out of his crease again, Ntini bowls it short and Sinclair misses the cut
yowza! Ntini digs in a quick bouncer, catching Sinclair on the charge, crashing into his helmet as he swivels on the pull, and he falls to the floor
good comeback! Sinclair gives Ntini the charge, this time lofting over mid-off
another bouncer, very high and its called no ball!
oh hello, he's literally smoked that! Sinclair! He simply dances down and drills a full delivery over extra cover for a flat six
attempted yorker isn't to perfection, Mills gives himself room outside leg stump and drives through the covers
slower ball, wide of the stumps on a length, Sinclair comes out but then waits, steering down to Pollock at third man
full and wide, Mills again makes room and cracks it out to Kallis at deep point
low full toss on middle and leg, Sinclair shuffles and clips wide of midwicket
Mills back away, Nel bowls it very wide off stump!
overpitched outside off, Mills gets down and drills it past extra cover for two
well bowled, very full outside off stump, close to being a yorker and Mills can only slash it down to Pollock at third man for one

inn2.comm: short of a length outside off stump, he gets forward and leaves it alone
short of a length,  moving away from the stumps and he leaves it be
and again, good shape away from van Wyk, but wide enough for him to leave

good grief, he's bowled him! MIlls pitches full and the ball holds its line, nipping through van Wyk's loose defense, easy as pie, just sneaking back and knocking back off stump! Mills strikes in just the first over as the replacement opener makes no impact today
short of a length, well wide and moving away, and Kallis lets it pass
thick edge! Kallis prods forward to one that gains on him, and only the soft hands manage to keep that down through gully, else he could've been a goner
short of a length outside off stump, rising up nicely and Kallis watches it pass
full outside off stump and Kallis square-drives to a diving Vincent at point
short of a length outside off stump, Kallis covers off and leaves it be
drifts away from down leg, Kallis misses out, the ball clipping his pads instead
good length, angled across the stumps and Smith leaves off the front foot
straighter one on about off stump, bringing Smith forward to defend to point
this one nips back in sharply and bounces, striking Kallis high inside the thigh as he lunges forward to defend
short of a length, seaming away nicely, inviting the shot from Kallis, but he just gets up and allows it pass safely
beaten! Mills produces a gem, hitting a short length and seaming away from Kallis' bat after he gets inside the line and plays away from his body, near perfect seam position from Mills
short of a length on off stump, forcing Kallis up on the toes and he defends it
again, near impeccable line and length, Kallis gets up and defends it down
short of a length on the stumps and Kallis has to defend to point again
short of a length, the scrambled seam squaring up and beating Smith as he shuffles and tries to play it towards leg
straighter delivery and Smith gets inside the line to defend it back
this one goes astray, just sliding down leg stump for a wide
short of a length, moving past Smith and he opts to shoulder arms
much fuller length, drawing a streaky thick edge from Smith's bat, as he pushes with no footwork, through the gap at gully for one
bouncer unsettles Kallis, who sways the head out of the way as he drops to his knees, losing his balance but comfortably getting one hand down to steady himself
follows up with a full delivery outside off, which Kallis leaves off the front foot
hits a good length and straightens, outside off stump, as Smith shoulders arms
too much width and Smith chases it, driving through the covers, and though its far from timed well, he does pick the gap and goes hard
good follow up from Mills, altering the length to make it closer to off stump, beating Smith's forward prod
this one pitches and comes in, and Smith, committed to the front foot, adjusts to tuck it straight to midwicket
good length on off stump, Smith pushes at it and places it wide of point
edged and caught at first slip! Mills continues his magic, hitting the deck at an uncomfortable height, squaring up Kallis who fends at it and loops up a simple catch to Taylor
tight delivery, short of a length and almost cramping Smith for room, but he rises with the ball and keeps it down safely in front of Vincent at point
much fuller now, just outside off stump, and Smith is caught on the back foot instead of coming forward, and he just manages to get  bat on that
tight shout! This one pitches very full, perhaps marginally outside off stump, and comes back in to strike Smith in front of the stumps as the bat comes down late!
full on off stump, he gets in line and defends to point
good length delivery on off stump, Smith gets behind it and defends, uneasily
shorter one this time, sitting up and Smith rolls it across the line to midwicket
bang on the money, no room to work with whatsoever, and de Villiers defends
good ball again, hitting a good length and going on straight as de Villiers pulls back the bat in time to hold back on a shot
and this one pitches full and goes away, as he comes forward and leaves
good length on off stump, de Villiers stays back and defends to gully
this one is too straight and de Villiers twirls it behind square leg for a couple
pitches outside leg stump and straightens, de Villiers tucks it to midwicket
short, wide, de Villiers leaps up and absolutely smashes it off the middle of the bat but cannot beat the man at cover
straighter, one a length, de Villiers hops up and tucks it to square leg this time
good bowling this, neither full nor short, on a decent length, and he defends it
peach! A slower ball from Gillespie, hitting a fuller length and moving away off the perfect seam as de Villiers pushes down the wrong line and misses it
short of a length, still no room on offer and de Villiers hops back to defend it
full on off stump, bringing de Villiers forward and he defends to backward point
nice ball, hitting a short length outside leg stump and rising past Smith, fending from his crease and trying to get inside the line, but missing completely
straighter delivery on off stump and this time Smith gets in line to defend it down
hits a good length and goes across Smith, who opts to shoulders arms now
tight, really tight stuff, not an inch to work with and Smith gets up tall to defend it back to Mills, making sure to get across and cover off stump
slower ball, fuller on off stump, Smith quickly gets over it and defends to cover
fullish length, moving away from Smith as he shoulders arms again
short of a length on middle and leg, he hops and works it behind square for two
good length well outside off stump, de Villiers gets across and leaves it be
fuller length, coming back off the seam as de Villiers decides to leave it
good length still wide of off stump, shaping away this time and again, he leaves
good length, with sharp carry through to McCullum, as de Villiers gets across and shoulders arms, the ball flicks his low elbow as it passes
short of a length outside off stump and once again, he leaves
strays a touch down the pads, Smith misses out on the tuck, McCullum collects and appeal but replays show Smith was no where near it
very full on off stump, Smith works it across the line with strong wrists, finding the fielder at square leg and its just a single
straighter delivery, de Villiers stumbles as he flicks to midwicket
good stuff, changing the pace and keeping it full and straight, and de Villiers gets behind the line to defend it back to Mills
short and rising, he gets tall and shoulders arms
drifts down the pads and he flicks out to deep backward square
short of a length down the pads, Smith hops up and nudges it to Martin at short fine leg
shot! de Villiers doesn't to much as move his hips to quickly scoop a short ball up and down to fine leg for four, all power in that, just a short-arm punch
again its short and this time he short-arm jabs much squarer, over midwicket, but the result is the same for de Villiers
short and wide, very wide, de Villiers chases it and slaps hard over backward point out to a fumbling fielder running around from third man
much fuller and closer to the stumps and de Villiers shoulders arms
short and wide, de Villiers smacks that to cover, where How fields superbly by diving to his right, but a throw onto the non-striker's stumps ricochets for a single
short outside leg stump, sits up and Smith awkwardly tries to play it off his ribs, not timed but he does pick the vacant spot in front of short fine leg
good length, full and going away from Smith, who leaves it be
fraction short and Smith gets across to cut behind point for a single
thats the line! Pitches full and moves away as de Villiers covers off stump but pushes down the wrong line, completely beaten
do not bowl there! Short and wide and de Villiers carves it through the covers and the ball races away to the boundary
and again, a great delivery, hitting the upright seam off a much fuller length and deviating away from de Villiers' bat as he plays forward and misses
too straight and de Villiers shuffles to work it away to midwicket
short of a length, Smith shuffles across to off stump and whips the ball away through the gap at midwicket out to the sweeper

dropped but what an effort! Martin bowls it short, de Villiers slashes very hard to backward point, where Taylor dives to his left, catches it, fumbles it, parries up in the air, cups his hand under it but it falls out of his palms!
short of a length outside leg stump, Smith turns it fine for one
too short and wide and he cuts it hard to Taylor again, who misfields and allows the single to de Villiers
strays onto leg stump, Smith uses his strong wrists to muscle it away through square leg, getting over it and rolling the hands
better from Martin, full and straight on off stump and Smith defends
full and going on down leg stump, de Villiers misses out on his flick and he ball rolls to midwicket
short and wide, he's lucky de Villiers smacks that straight to point
good length on off stump, de Villiers comes forward and defends
good length outside off stump, teasing and inviting the drive, but de Villiers decides he's better off shouldering arms
short and wide, de Villiers chops his attempted cut into the ground in front of point and Mills is lucky again to get away with that delivery
pitches full outside leg stump and he tucks it away for a single
short of a length just outside off, he gets up and inside-edges it back
bang, thats four! Just too much width and de Villiers flays it through the covers with some bat speed, hard cut shot that
slower delivery, fullish on leg stump and he plays it back to Martin
short again, perhaps a touch too fine to cut, and de Villiers leaves it be as it rises nicely to McCullum behind the stumps
fuller length, closer to the stumps, and de Villiers pushes at it off the front foot, beaten by the slowness off the pitch
full on off stump,  he defends and turns the bat in his hands, stealing a quick single in front of midwicket to end the over
overpitched outside off stump, de Villiers greets it with a firm drive through the covers and out to the man at sweeper
short of a length on leg stump, he gets up and whips it through square leg out to the ropes, where a tag-team effort keeps him to two
short outside leg stump, he gets up and pulls into the gap at short fine leg, getting over it and rolling the wrists to keep it down
slower ball, attempted yorker, too full and de Villiers drives to cover
too short, too wide, and he cuts in the air through the yawning gap at point for another boundary
slower ball, short of a length, de Villiers gets up and defends
good length on off stump, Smith pushes to cover
much fuller, attempted yorker, Smith counters it with a push to cover
full outside off stump, angling in, Smith clips to an active mid-on
short and wide again, sits up with that tennis ball bounce and he waits, slapping through point out to Sinclair at deep point
fullish on off stump, Smith drives straight back to Martin
tight stuff from around the stumps, keeping it simple and straight and Smith has to get in line to defend back to Martin
tossed up down leg stump, a wide to start off with
tossed up on the stumps, he shuffles and works it to midwicket
tossed up on off stump, he leans forward and drives to cover for one
tossed up outside off stump, Smith gets across and defends
tossed up invitingly, Smith waits and opens the face, trying to run it fine but beaten by the turn
tossed up on leg stump, he gets down and scoops towards square leg for another single
cheeky! de Villiers waits for it, opening the face at the last second, steering wide of the keeper
four more! Smith tries to slash it away over the infield but mistimes, its a leading-edge over the slips
straighter delivery, he shuffles and taps it away for one
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up and drops the hands, calling for a quick single in front of cover, well run that time
slower ball, full on off stump, driven straight to midwicket
close, so close! Smith doesn't pick this one, trying to go over extra cover but scooping it up in the air to mid-off, Vettori, who reacts late and slides in front of what could have been a catch
short of a length outside off stump, de Villiers waits and dabs it to third man
tossed up on a length, steered to How at backward point
fraction short, allowing de Villiers to get back and push into the covers
slow ball on middle and leg, Smith makes room and works it to midwicket for another easy single as this partnership chugs along
again its short and he cuts wide of point for a single
full and flat on off stump, Smith works it to mid-on for one
slow through the air, looped up outside leg stump, de Villiers plays it off the pad as McCullum comes forward to field
full outside off stump, Smith mistimes his drives to cover
just drifts onto leg stump and Smith picks two into the big gap at square leg, McCullum has to do the fielding
short of a length outside off stump, he opens the face and runs to point
hammered, as Smith gives himself room to leg and creams a short delivery up and over the arms of Vincent at cover for a hard boundary
full on off stump, Smith pushes off the front foot to mid-off for one
full and straight on the stumps, de Villiers tries to flick but mistimes it
tossed up on a length outside off stump, Smith waits for the turn and then runs it wide of point for one
drifts down leg stump, de Villiers kneels down and sweeps, missing out
too short outside off and he cuts out to deep point for one more
the arm ball, quicker delivery, Smith goes back and pushes to mid-on
flat down leg stump, de Villiers flicks it away for another single
another arm ball, pitching on middle stump, Smith nudges it into the gap
slower ball, off a length outside off stump, Smith opens the face, late, and steers it down to third man for one
short of a length, de Villiers doesn't move much as he cuts this backward of point and down towards third man
too straight and Smith nudges it through the gap at square leg
full just outside off stump, de Villiers drives straight to cover
straight on off stump, driven back to Styris
full and wide but again, he cant beat short cover with his drive
tossed up outside off stump, Smith presses forward and plays to point
tossed up outside leg stump, wide called as Vettori hops up
tossed up outside leg, de Villiers makes room and drives to mid-on
gives it some air outside off stump, Smith reaches out and pushes uppishly through the covers, running hard and making it back as good throw comes back

smart work from McCullum, Vettori tosses it up wide again, Smith strides forward and drives, the ball sneaks past the bat, and in a flash the bails are off, but replays shows Smith's back leg was just inside the line
fuller and flatter outside off stump, Smith tries to work it to leg and ends up with a leading-edge just past point
too short, de Villiers rocks back and cuts out to deep extra cover
full outside off stump, de Villiers laces this through the covers to post his 11th ODI half-century, good innings and the 100 is on the board
this one sits up and clips Smith on one of the fingers, the ball rolling to leg

0h, well caught Martin! Smith gets a rank long hop and pulls over midwicket, rather poorly as he struggled to time the shot, and the fielder on the ropes gets low to his left and cups a good catch, sliding to his knees an inch inside the boundary. Its awfully close, even as Martin smiles and runs in. The catch is referred to the third umpire, and after a long time the decision is that his back leg did not brush the boundary demarcation. Now that was a tough, tough call to make. It looked very close. So Smith has to go for 44. Boy, he's fuming at himself. Out to a long hop.
full on the stumps, he gets forward and drives to midwicket for one
full and wide outside off stump, Duminy leaves it be
strays onto leg stump, Duminy quickly tucks that to midwicket for one
short outside off stump, he reaches out and cuts to point
tossed up on off stump, he gets in line and defends back to Vettori
spins sharply and draws the outside edge, and gully does well to stop that
tossed up on a length, he comes forward and drives wide of point for one
flatter trajectory outside off, Duminy gets across and plays back to Vettori
tossed up generously on middle and off, he comes forward and defends
take that, says de Villiers, sashaying down the track and driving, inside-out, through extra cover and mid-off for a gorgeous shot
pitches on leg stump, de Villiers tucks it straight to midwicket
bit of room outside off stump, he opens the face and runs past gully for one
this one sits up nicely outside off, Duminy gets tall and guides to third man
drifts onto the pads and de Villiers clips into the gap, Mills runs around from fine leg and does the fielding but de Villiers is like a hare
good length outside off stump, driven straight to cover
tossed up outside off stump, he reaches out and drives to cover
tossed up short, slower delivery, he goes for the cut and misses
tossed up on off stump, he gets back and drives to midwicket for one
tossed up on off stump, de Villiers waits and drives wide of point
tossed up on middle and leg, Duminy clips fine for one
drifts onto the pads and he uses the spin to turn it into the gap
slants into leg stump, he shuffles and tucks it wide of midwicket for one
slower ball, looped up on off stump, Duminy gets bat on it just in time
slides down leg stump, deviates finer and McCullum dives a long way to his right, getting a hand on it but parrying it away for a leg-bye
bit too short and de Villiers cuts out to deep backward point
slower ball, full on off stump, Duminy pushes at it and gets an inside-edge to square leg and my, thats some fast running between these two
good length on off stump, he gets forward and pushes to cover
full on off stump, turned to the man at midwicket
short of a length outside off stump, he gets up and defends to point
poor ball, too full and astray of leg stump, Martin's poor day continues
follows up with a slower ball outside leg stump, de Villiers makes room and ends up driving lazily to midwicket this time
slow ball, looping wide of off stump, de Villiers kneels down and slashes past extra cover and mid-off, that was firmly struck
good length this time, de Villiers waits and taps it to point
sits up nicely outside off, rather wide, and he steers it down to third man
strays onto leg stump, de Villiers turns it past square leg for one more
full outside off stump, Duminy reaches out and drives to cover
much better, the identical ball but this time he drives wide of the fielder for four
slower ball outside off stump, sits up at an awkward height, Duminy rises with it and guides it down to third man
full on leg stump, de Villiers clears the back leg and drives down to long-on
overpitched outside off stump, he drives hard but cover dives and fields
straight on the stumps, tucks it to midwicket and Duminy responds very well
short of a length, comes back in and Duminy tucks it to midwicket
short of a length and wider, he hops up and cant run it past a diving point, How it is
slower ball, much fuller, Duminy gets onto the front foot and pushes to How
straighter delivery and Duminy drives between de Villiers and the stumps, Mills is positioned down at long-on and runs around to field, but he's sluggish
short of a length on off stump, Duminy gets up and defends back to Martin
short of a length, de Villiers uses the width and bounce to cheekily play it very late past the 'keeper and down to a diving third man, who does well to stop it
good length outside off stump, he comes forward and pushes to point
quicker and fuller, Duminy drives to the on side and gets a leading edge to point, but it doesn't carry to How there
fraction short and Duminy gets over it, cutting hard down past point, and Gillespie covers plenty of ground in the deep to field
good length on off stump, played to the close-in fielder this time
again too short and he cuts out to deep backward point
tossed up on a length, Duminy drives back to the bowler
tossed up pretty wide, Duminy reaches out and slaps it through midwicket
tossed up even wider, drawing Duminy out but the ball does too much
quicker and flatter, he shuffles and works it to square leg
tossed up on the stumps, Duminy gets down and slams it to mid-on
tossed up leg stump, he flicks to square leg, Vincent dives and fires in a tight throw, de Villiers looks to be just in and replays confirm as much .. man, he can run like lightning
tossed up on the stumps, he makes room and drives for a sharp single
good length just outside off, he kneels forward and pushes to point
shot, width on offer and de Villiers wastes no time in slashing over point
short and wide again, he cuts but this time it brings him just one
nice shot, leaning to the pitch of a full delivery and driving through extra cover
the reply is a bouncer over the stumps, forcing him to duck low
and bounces him again, but its very, very short over leg stump and called wide
short of a length outside off stump, angled away to third man
tossed up wide of the stumps, Duminy reaches for it and sweeps to leg
flatter on off stump, he gets forward and drives nicely through the covers
tossed up invitingly on off stump, he nudges it to midwicket for one
speared down the pads, de Villiers tucks to square leg, Duminy is struggling but the throw is off the mark and he survives
deft touch, as he gets down and paddles one from off stump to fine leg
tossed up outside off stump, he makes room and cuts wide of point
full and wide of off stump, he leans into it and thrashes out to deep cover
full down leg stump, clips the pads and rolls fine for a leg-bye
slower ball, slides down leg stump, de Villiers nudges into the gap and runs hard for two, very well run that
good yorker, de Villiers digs it out to extra cover
quicker one, extra pace and bounce beats him as he tries to cut
slower ball on middle and leg, he drives with a sizable gap between bat and pad, the ball sneaks down to fine leg and these two legends sprint two more
tossed up on a length, he gets back and punches down to long-on

smart catch! Vettori teases him with the length, inviting him into a drive, de Villiers uses his feet and hits it hard back over Vettori's head, but he nonchalantly sticks his right hand up and intercepts it excellently. Good reflexes to end a fine innings from de Villiers
tossed up on a length and Boucher gets over it, smothering the spin
well bowled, the quicker one, spins in as Boucher drives and misses
quick again, spins in and catches Boucher on the defensive, there look to be two noises as bat hits pad, Vettori and McCullum belt out and appeal but Brian Jerling  isn't convinced
tossed up a touch wider, he leans forward and drives for one to cover
good length on the stumps, stays low and Boucher defends to leg
full outside off stump, pushed to point, Boucher wants one but is sent back
good length on middle and leg, turned to midwicket, another dot ball
short of a length, too close to cut and he's beaten going for it
fraction short and this time he pulls into the ground through midwicket
full on the stumps, Duminy gets forward is mistimes his defensive shot
tossed up on middle and off, Boucher defends back to Vettori
uses the feet, Vettori bowls it full and flat, Boucher flicks for one
tossed up flat outside off stump, he drives, a misfield at short cover allows three and Vettori is not happy at all, looks like Taylor it was there who goofed
a touch short on off stump, Boucher backs away and cuts for one
flat outside off stump, Duminy shuffles across and taps one to leg
full and flat, tight off-stump line, Duminy works it to midwicket
short and wide, Boucher frees the arms and cuts out to deep cover for one
too far down leg stump, he tries to flick but the ball clips his boot and runs fine
full outside off stump, Boucher gets forward and drives back to Martin
wide outside off stump, he fails to put it away, cutting straight to point
dropped! A frustrated Boucher uses his feet, hitting up and over mid-on to Sinclair, running in from long-on very late, he dives forward but spills the catch
full on off stump, Duminy presents a full face of the bat and drives back past Martin to long-off, good shot for one
good length outside off stump, he makes room and drives towards point
slower ball, sluggish off the pitch as Boucher mistimes a drive back to him
too wide of the stumps as Boucher makes room and then goes back
slower ball on middle and leg, Boucher makes room and drives to mid-off
good length outside off stump, Boucher drags it into the ground and sets off
he can hit sixes, thats what he can do! All composure, he gets down and swipes Styris over long-on for half a dozen, what a clean strike that was
good length outside off stump, he makes room and carves into the covers
sharp, short of a length outside off stump, he taps it down towards gully
bouncer, very high outside off stump, wide not called and Boucher is ticked
fuller length now, and he has a big heave, edging down to wide third man
low full toss outside off stump, driven past cover and point to the deep
slower ball out the back of the hand, Boucher gives him the charge, connecting well for once and creaming it through the covers to send the dormant Durban crowd into a tizzy
straighter on off stump, Boucher hits it back down the ground past the stumps, Duminy is too sharp, running back towards the danger end and makes his ground, electric running
good length outside off, he pokes and misses, McCullum whips off the bails
good length outside off stump, he makes room and taps to point
again he makes room to leg, not hitting this cleanly but getting it over the covers and it drops between two fielders
short ball on middle and leg, he waits and pulls through square leg
short outside off stump, Duminy pulls loosely and the ball dies just in front of midwicket, pretty close that was
drilled, too full on the stumps and he straight drives very hard, Jerling does well to take evasive action, the ball races away and beats long-off's despairing dive

yes he can! Martin pitches very short, Duminy goes for a hurried pull, the ball gaining on him and catching the splice of the bat, spooning out to midwicket where Patel, the sub, takes a simple enough catch
no, no, not  that way ... Martin bounces him and thats called wide
much fuller this time, Boucher gets low and squeezes towards point
immaculate! First ball, Pollock squirts a good-length delivery smack between the wide slip and wicketkeeper for four, crucial runs that
short of a length down leg, the inside-edge onto the thigh pad gets him one
full in the blockhole, Boucher advances and drives out to deep cover
short of a length outside off stump, again Pollock pushes at it and the genuine outside edge flies wide of slip to third man
short of a length, Pollock makes room and cuts right to point ... dot ball

caught! Pollock biffs Mills back over his head, making room, but doesn't get enough on it as Taylor runs across and pouches it at long-off! Mills must be a relieved man, given how tense that ODI got during South Africa's last tour of New Zealand. He gets a third wicket
slower ball outside off stump, he reaches out and drives to cover
slower ball goes wrong, slanting down leg stump for a wide
full outside leg stump, he shuffles and works it back to Mills

spectacular catch! Morkel flashes at a short delivery, cramped for room, and gets a thick outside edge that flies low and hard to McCullum's left, but he times his dive to perfection and snaps it up, one-handed, an inch off the ground! He's cock-a-hoop after that, and why not?
good ball, shaping away from him as he has a flirt, there's a noise, possibly pad, McCullum collects and asks the question but the umpire says nope
full on leg stump, clipped through midwicket and they sprint two, well run
yorker outside off stump, he reaches out and squeezes one to gully
full outside leg stump, clipped through midwicket for one
strays down leg stump, a full toss, rubbish ball, and Boucher punishes it with a flick down to fine leg
another full toss, this time Boucher swivels around and mistimes it nto the gap at square leg, that could've gone anywhere!
good stop, as Botha kneels down and paddles another low full toss on leg stump around the corner, but fine leg, up in the circle, dives and takes some pace off the ball
hah! He drives a full delivery from the crease, losing the bat from his grip, it slips up and thuds into midwicket, splicing into two pieces, but Boucher runs one
slower ball, fullish outside off stump, Botha swats it over mid-on and it falls between two men in the deep, Boucher sprints through very well
tries to get cheeky, stepping outside off and going for the paddle but Mills chases it him and the ball balloon up off his shoulder to gully
full outside off stump, Boucher swings wildly and mistimes it off the toe and of the bat, then runs one to third man
he gets another! Good length outside off stump, Botha fetches it and mistimes the slog out to Vincent at long-on, who punches the air on completion of that catch

slides down leg stump, Boucher walks across and tries to paddle, misses, sets off, McCullum has a shy back to the stumps but misses as Boucher dives full length to get back in ... would've been out had he hit!
big heave! Nel closes his eyes and gives it an almighty heave, missing by miles ... not wise from the big man
dropped! Nel slashes a full and wide delivery up and over backward point, a fielder runs after at is it dies on him, diving out in front and failing to hold on! Very tough catch
good bowling, fullish and Boucher swings across the line, picking up an inside-edge that gets Nel back on strike
oh he's absolutely nailed that! Nel! Makes room and drives a full delivery in the blockhole through extra cover and Durban cheers like there's no tomorrow
Andre Nel! He's literally smoked that! Its full again and he drills it through extra cover, who had no chance, and the game is tied! Would you believe this?

Andre Nel is a hero under starry Durban tonight! What a gem! Third ball in a row, he makes room and drills a full delivery through point and the South Africans erupt! South win by two wickets off the final ball and New Zealand's horror tour continues!
